byline.original: By SHANNON DOYNE, KATHERINE SCHULTEN and HOLLY OJALVO

lead_paragraph: Overview | What is an allusion? How often do you spot them, whether in your reading, in pop culture, in advertising or anywhere else? In this lesson, students read a Book Review essay about allusions in literature, take a quiz in which they identify allusions made in New York Times articles and headlines, then choose from a variety of activities to go deeper.

headline.main: It's All an Allusion: Identifying Allusions, in Literature and in Life
